attributes.action: Need a 150% mortgage so developer makes £17 million profits
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
My apartment was due to be completed in November 2008.  We gave the developer a completion date of march the 26th,  which was served one month previous. They gave us reasons for the delay(weather, historical dig etc.), even though we have copies of the further planning they applied for which was only granted in February 2009.
They gave us a date to complete on the 30th April. But when we sent our surveyor in the apartment block was still a building site. The reports states it is not liveable.
My concern now is that we are most likely going to be taken to court for damages. 
The initial price is £185000, our deposit was £18500, the current value of the apartment is £125000.
These figures apply to 110 other members of the public.
My issue is with the banks in difficulty etc and mortgages difficult to obtain there is no way I’m going to be able to find £60k to add to the deposit.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
